title: Marie Curie
summary: Marie Salomea Curie was a Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity and was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

quiz.question: In which country was Marie Curie born?
quiz.explanation: Marie Curie was born in Warsaw, Poland in 1867.

quiz.question: What element did Marie Curie discover?
quiz.explanation: Marie Curie discovered polonium and named it after her native country Poland.

quiz.question: How many Nobel Prizes did Marie Curie win?
quiz.explanation: Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize in Physics (1903, shared with Pierre Curie) and the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (1911).

quiz.question: What is radioactivity?
options: Emission of radiation from unstable atoms
quiz.answer: Emission of radiation from unstable atoms
quiz.explanation: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of radiation from unstable atomic nuclei, a phenomenon extensively studied by Marie Curie.
